title: How to Create a Turban With a Towel to Dry Wet Hair

steps.title: Blot dry your hair.
steps.content: Blot dry your hair. When you get out of the shower or bath, blot your hair gently with a towel. Your goal is to stop it from dripping but not to dry it completely.

steps.title: Apply hair products while your hair is still wet.
steps.content: Apply hair products while your hair is still wet. Using hair products in wet hair allows them to be distributed more evenly. Add the products before you wrap your hair and they will soak into your locks and boost their effectiveness. You will want to save finishing products such as hair spray until you are ready to style, but you can add others at this stage: [1] X Research source Volumizer Detangler Leave-in conditioner Straightening balm Curling Serum

steps.title: Comb your hair to remove tangles.
steps.content: Comb your hair to remove tangles. Combing your hair before wrapping it helps prevent damage. Wet hair is the most susceptible to damage, so make sure you comb it gently. Use a wide toothed comb instead of a brush to detangle wet hair. Comb small sections at a time. Comb through tangles gently to avoid tearing your hair.

steps.title: Bend over at the waist to allow your hair to hang down.
steps.content: Bend over at the waist to allow your hair to hang down. [2] X Expert Source Kelsey Morey Professional Hair and Makeup Artist Expert Interview. 11 January 2022. In order to wrap your head in a towel, hang your hair upside down to fit it all in the towel.

steps.title: Tuck your chin into your chest.
steps.content: Tuck your chin into your chest. You will be looking backwards between your legs to let your hair hang upside down. Pull your hair off your shoulders and make sure it is all hanging downward. Note Keep your head down until your towel is secured around your hair.

steps.title: Choose the right towel.
steps.content: Choose the right towel. [3] X Expert Source Kelsey Morey Professional Hair and Makeup Artist Expert Interview. 11 January 2022. You need a towel that is long enough to cover all of your hair when wrapped, but not so long that it will be too heavy and fall down. [4] X Research source The towel should cover your head and still hang past your shoulders when standing upright. If you have hair past your shoulders, you may need a longer towel. Thin towels are better than thick, fluffy towels. Microfiber towels and t-shirts work extremely well to do the turban tie with.

steps.title: Drape the towel over your hair.
steps.content: Drape the towel over your hair. While your hair is hanging down, use the towel to cover all of your hair from the back of your head. [5] X Research source Place the long edge of the towel at your hairline on the back of your neck. Center the towel on the center of your neck.

steps.title: Wrap the towel around your hair from back to front.
steps.content: Wrap the towel around your hair from back to front. Fold the towel around your head tucking one side under the other. Keep your hair inside the towel as your wrap it around your head.

steps.title: Twist the two sides of the towel around each other with your hair inside.
steps.content: Twist the two sides of the towel around each other with your hair inside. Continue to twist the towel until it reaches your forehead. [6] X Expert Source Kelsey Morey Professional Hair and Makeup Artist Expert Interview. 11 January 2022.

steps.title: Stand upright and bring the towel twist toward the back of your head.
steps.content: Stand upright and bring the towel twist toward the back of your head. The twist should be on top of your head going from your forehead to the back of your head.

steps.title: Secure the twist by tucking it under the back of the towel.
steps.content: Secure the twist by tucking it under the back of the towel. Place the end of the twisted towel under the turban at the back of your hairline to keep it in place. You can also use a hair clip to hold the towel in place for extra security.

steps.title: Re-wrap your hair in a dry towel.
steps.content: Re-wrap your hair in a dry towel. If you are taking your time getting ready, you can exchange your wet towel for a dry one to help your hair dry even faster. The more moisture your towel absorbs, the less it will be able to remove from your hair. Replace the wet towel with a dry one, and the drying process will go even faster. [7] X Research source
